name: Dr. Rahman
summary: Public health consultant with MPH and MBBS, experienced in GMP program implementation, immunization, maternal and child health, and community health campaigns. Skilled in program design, data reporting, health education, and stakeholder engagement.

experience.title: Consultant
experience.description: Identified GMP program implementation deficits and suggested recommendations for improvement; reviewed project documentation to locate gaps; conducted field visits to four districts in southwest to observe and provide technical input to ongoing child nutrition activities with specific focus on GMP sessions; located gaps in program participation and data reporting and monitoring; presented research findings to relevant stakeholders.

experience.title: Public Health Campaign Volunteer
experience.description: Participated in campaigns for ante-natal check-ups and educating mothers about breastfeeding; conducted physical examinations, provided treatment and follow-up; contributed to Expanded Program on Immunization (EPI) including vaccination campaigns (DPT, MMR, BCG). Volunteered during medical studies.

experience.title: Volunteer / Community Health Campaign Participant
experience.description: Engaged in community education about maternal health (eclampsia); promoted ORS usage to reduce diarrhea-related mortality; participated in blood donation campaigns, collected donor histories, and provided medical information.

experience.title: Physician (Family Medicine)
experience.description: Treated patients, performed physical examinations, provided consultations and follow-up services.

education.school: Bangladesh Medical College, University of Dhaka
